intro: Gymnopetalum scabrum, commonly known as the roughleaf lily, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear small, white or pale pink flowers with six petals. Gymnopetalum scabrum thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native range.
